subject: Cybersecurity
title: Bluetooth Attacks: Hacking Through Your Headphones
description: A quick, practical guide to Bluetooth Attacks: Hacking Through Your Headphones.

hook.text: Your Bluetooth headphones could be the entry point hackers use to access your phone without touching it.

buildup.text: Bluetooth vulnerabilities include BlueBorne (remote takeover), KNOB (key negotiation), and BlueSmack (denial.

discovery.text: BlueBorne in 2017 could spread between devices without pairing. Over 5 billion devices were vulnerable.

twist.text: Bluetooth range is supposed to be 30 feet, but with directional antennas, attackers can reach Bluetooth devices.

climax.text: Bluetooth is an often-forgotten attack surface. It's always on, always discoverable, and rarely updated.

punchline.text: 5 billion devices. One vulnerability. No pairing needed.

quiz.question: What made the BlueBorne vulnerability especially dangerous?
options: It could spread between devices without pairing, affecting 5 billion devices
It was too complex to exploit
